item.title: Advice from a 4.00 GPA CS Freshman
item.description: 1. Take classes with the course chair Taking classes with the course chair for courses with multiple sections such as Linear Algebra guarantees you a proficient teacher. They will most likely provide extra perks such as review sessions and review sheets. You are also guaranteed that the instructor will cover everything on the tests so you won’t have to worry about your professorÂ omitting something. I took Calculus I with the course chair my freshman year.
